The moving mouse: tooltips (do it yourself)

For the video, goto https://youtu.be/iDoCU0f3hro

This text contains some tooltips. Create code that shows their text when the mouse hovers over them.

Note that the value of the @data-ttref attribute at the tooltip corresponds with the @id attribute of a hidden HTML <p>.

Tip: use ixsl:onmouseover and ixsl:onmouseout and the extension instruction <ixsl:set-style name="visibility" select="'visible|hidden'" ..>.

You will find the solution in the file mousemove-diy_.xslt.

A tekst is some meaninful sequence of words.

A tooltip is a text that is visible when the mouse hovers above some area.

The onmouseover event occurs when the mouse pointer is moved onto an element, or onto one of its children.

The onmouseout event occurs when the mouse pointer is moved out of an element, or out of one of its children.

The SaxonJS ixsl:set-style extension instruction sets a style property of an HTML element.
